exclusion: The device is excluded by triple click to one of the buttons.
inclusion: Triple click one of the buttons on the device will include the device
label: ZME_05431
overview: The switch Flush Mountable is a wireless actuator able to switch loads up to 2300 W. The device is delivered as complete set with flush mountable insert, paddle and mounting frame compatible to the design of the switching series Everlux in color white from REV / Duewi. The paddle of the device is used to control the device itself but can also be configured to activate scenes in a central IP gateway or controller. The status of the switch is indicated on a dual color LED for test purposes and every status change is - if configured - reported to a central IP gateway or controller. The function of the local paddle can be configured as detached from the local operation. In this local control, different devices are controlled by Z-Wave while the local actuator is controlled by other devices using Z-Wave. This device is designed for a 3 wire system and needs a neutral wire in the wall box.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Automatic switch off
parameters.description: If not zero, automatically switch off after a user defined time

parameters.label: Function of RF off command
parameters.overview: Defines how to interpret RF Off command. Can be used in conjunction with Auto Off function: Ignore - to switch on the light by motion detectors and switch it off after some amount of time: in case of multiple motion detectors each would try to switch the light off that would break logics; Switch on - to switch on the light on both On and Off paddle press on the remote and switch it off after some amount of time. Button off click will still work (if button operations are not disabled).

options.label: Switch on if load is off else switch off

parameters.label: Switch on dimming by buttons
parameters.overview: Defines if the switch should change it state to on/off if it is dimmed by buttons

parameters.label: Restore switch state after power cycle
parameters.description: Restore switch state after power cycle
parameters.overview: Defines if the switch should restore switch state to the last state prior to device power off (power cycle).

parameters.label: Typical click timeout
parameters.overview: Typical time used to differentiate click, hold, double and triple clicks<BR/>Defined in 10ms ticks.

parameters.label: Switch by buttons
parameters.overview: If disabled, the local operations by buttons will not switch the load, but only send commands to On/Off association group. In this mode buttons are not linked with the switch

parameters.label: Action on button single press or hold
parameters.description: Action on button single press or hold
parameters.overview: Defines which command should be sent on button single press or hold. Basic and Scene Activation commands are sent to Association group. Use Scene Controller Conf to set up Scene ID for Scene Activation. Switch All commands are sent broadcast.

options.label: Switch On, Off and dim using Basic Set

parameters.label: Action on button double press or hold
parameters.description: Action on button double press or hold
parameters.overview: Defines which command should be sent on button double press or press-hold. Basic and Scene Activation commands are sent to Association group. Use Scene Controller Conf to set up Scene ID for Scene Activation. Switch All commands are sent broadcast. If not disabled, the device will wait for a click timeout to see if the second click would be pressed. This will introduce a small delay for single click commands

options.label: Switch On, Off and dim using Basic Set

What to do on button Down press

options.label: Switch On if load is Off, else switch Off
